beelzebub like blaſphemie agaynſt holy ghoſt attribute miracle done saincts either dead aliue diuel 30 indifferent al religionsneuters religion commonly fitly called neuter • oyning ſelues neither part let marke theſe wordes wel ſhal ſee chriſt accoumpted al agaynſt church plainely flatly 30 gathereth ſpeaketh owne perſon al hath committed gouernement church ſpecially cheefe paſtours ſucceeding peter gouernement wholeep • 8 hierom writing damaſus pope rome applieth theſe word vnto ſaying al heretikes gathereth thee ſcattereth ſay chriſt antichriſt 31 blaſphemie spirit meaneth ſinne ſo great god wil forgiue whereof man may repēt life ſome heretikes day affirme ſome heinous ſinnes namely blaſphemie iewes againſt eu • dent workes holy ghoſt likewiſe archeheretikes wilfully reſiſt knowē truth workes holy ghoſt god church hardly forgeuen ſeldom haue ſuch men grace repent otherwiſe among al ſinnes agaynſt holy ghoſt commonly reckened ſixe one ſhal neuer forgiuenfinal impenitence dying without repentance wilfully called final impenitence ſinne committeth dieth contempt sacrament penance obſtinatly refuſing abſolution church miniſterie auguſtine plainely declareth theſe wordesremiſſion ſinnes church whoſoeuer beleueth man ſinnes remitted god church therfore deſpiſeth bountifulnes god ſo mighty worke obſtinat minde continue tll liues end guilty ſinne againſt holy ghoſt holy ghoſt chriſt remitteth ſinnes enchir 83 ep 50 fine 32 sonne man iewes wordes ſinned againſt ſonne man reprehended thoſe thing man witte calling therfore glutton great drinker wine freend publican taking offenſe becauſe kept company ſinnes brake sabboth ſuch like ſinne might eaſely forgiuen becauſe iudged would haue done man ſinned blaſphemed againſt holy ghoſt called finger god whereby wrought miracle malice attributed euident workes god caſting diuels diuel ſelf ſinne ſhal remitted becauſe ſhal hardly remitted ſee plague poſteritie vntil day 3 • world come auguſtine holy proteſtants haue regard becauſe common vvine vvhich occupie church knovving chriſts ovvne bloud muſt haue al dreadful regard therfore ſay ſhe hath decreed ſome hundreth yeres put vſethe prieſts ſay vvel ſacrificing receiuinglu 22 19 vvhom properly vvas ſaid vvas ſpoken onely ſuch haue povver thereby offer conſecrate1 cor 11 lay men clergie alſo vvhen execute ſay maſſe ſelues ſhould receiue one iuriſdictiō al chriſtendom see haue euer done alſo acknowledged principality soueraintie peter succeſſors yet would iuſt cauſes vſe title ſubiect vanitie miſconſtructiō al pope ſince haue rather called ſelues seruos ſeruorum dei seruants god ſeruants though word vniuerſal biſhop ſenſe wherein holy councel chalcedon offered see romethe title vniuerſal biſhop refuſed vniuerſal iuriſdiction alwaies acknowledged practiſed true lawful councel would haue giuen antichriſtian vniuſt title man onely b conſtantinople ſenſe right vſurped falſe tyrannical meaning inſolent vniuſt chriſts ſheepe onely giuen peter perſon alſo ſucceſſors pope rome chryſoſtom alſo alleaged doth teſtifie writeth thus eugenius thou art key heauen deliuered ſheepe cō mitted porter heauē paſtors flockes thou haſt inherited glorious differēt ſortthe pope paſtor al paſtors haue euery one particular flocke thee al vniuerſally one flocke one mā credited onely paſtor ſheepe one paſtor al paſtors athanaſius alſo auoucheth ſame serm euang de deipara aſſumption body bernard alſo wrote fiue notable ſermons extant workes neither theſe holy fathersthe proteſtāts haue feaſt al haue saincts church tradition teſtimonie beare ſway day proteſtants haue aboliſhed greateſt feaſt aſſumption reaſon ſhould leaſt celebrate day death doe saincts though beleeue body aſſumpted yet wil trow deny ſhe dead may thought diuel beareth ſpecial malice woman whoſe ſeede brake head two day purification aununciation proper lady one chriſts conception preſentation▪ ſo ſhe meanes ſhal haue feſtiuitie al maiſtreſſe ephrem lady queen mother god moſt holy auncient ephrem alſo ſpecial oration made praiſe lady ſaith thus diuerſe place thereof intemerata de • p ••• c mother god vndifiled queene al hope deſpaire lady moſt glorious higher heauenly ſpirit • honorable cherubins holier seraphins▪ vvithout compariſon glorious thē ſupernal hoſtes hope father glorie prophet praiſe apoſtles litle virgo ante tari • vvhen god reuealeth v thinggods predeſtination appointment taketh away man free vvil endeuours aſſureth v euent come diſchargeth v thereby requiſite endeuours labour atcheiuing ſame executing ordinarily deſignements tovvards men othervviſe ovvne free vvil action paul ſaid let v vvhat vve liſt vvorke vve ſit vve ſtil vvhether mariner goe tarie vvithin vve al ſure ſaued ſo god hath reuealed lie neither fall othervviſe▪ contrarievviſe ſaith he▪ theſe mariner leaue ſhip ſaued ſay al true catholike preacher chriſtian people vvhat prouidence predeſtination foreſight ſo euer god haue ſaluation thereby conſtrained vvay haue free vvil ſtil ſaued though predeſtinate except keepe god commaundements repent ſinnes beleeue liue die vvel vvere reuealed mā1 cor 9 2 • ▪ vvere one god reſurrection fleſh 12 life euerlaſting amen ❧ argvment epistle general goſpels vvhich ſtorie chriſt himſelfe actes apoſtles vvhich ſtorie chriſtes church novv folovv epiſtles apoſtles vvhich vvrote ſuch matter occaſion vvrite founder doctor church time doctor ſucceeded vvho beginning vnto day haue vvritten epiſtles bookes againſt hereſies euer aroſe▪ al eccleſiaſtical matter occaſion miniſtred vnto vvhich apoſtles firſt gaue enſample alſo luke actes apoſtles led vvay al writer eccleſiaſtical hiſtorie al though compariſon betvvene authoritie aſmuch theſe cannonical scripture ſo vvritings ſucceſſors yet occaſions matter haue ſaid like moſt theſe epiſtles paules epiſtleseuſeb li 2 eccl hiſt c 22 reſt called catholicae epiſtolae epiſtles catholike paul vvriteth epiſtle al hovvbeit euery one al church ſome particular church gentils romanes corinthian galatian epheſians philippian coloſsians theſſalonians ſome particular perſons timothee tite vvho vvere biſhops among gentile vvit epheſus crete philémon one hebrevves vvho vvere ievves hieruſalem iurie epiſtles apoſtles iames peter iohn iude ſo intituled one church perſon except iohns tvvo later ſhort epiſtles vvhich yet might ſeparated firſt becauſe vvere al one author therefore termed catholike vniuerſal ſo vvriteth iames tvvelue tribe diſperſion greeting▪ peter firſt epiſtle thus elect ſtrāgers diſperſion pontus galatia cappadocia aſia bithynia ſecond thus haue obteined equal faith vvith v likevviſe iude god father beloued ieſus chriſt preſerued called iohns firſt vvithout title novv occaſions vvriting vvhereby vve ſhal perceiue matter argument handle muſt remembred storie time actes apoſtles doth large declare church beginning vvas planted apoſtles onely ievves alſo gentile yea ſpecially gentile vvhich thing offended ievves many way could abide ſee ſo much owne countrie receiue christ vvhom reiected crucified much leſſe ſee preach gentile alſo offended euen thoſe ievves alſo beleeued chriſt hovvbeit ſuch vvere catholikes therefore obſtinat vvere ſatisfied vvhen vnderſtood apoſtles vvas god pleaſure act 11 vve reade others became heretikes preached chriſtian gentile vvas neceſſary receiue alſo ievves religion ſuch vve reade act 15 vnles circumciſed ſaued theſe ſo preach againſt truth ſo vnchriſtened ievves onely ſelues perſecute alſo ſtirre vp idolatrous gentile euery vvhere perſecute chriſtians ſuch obſtinacie prouoking god reprobate theire nation vvhich yet thought vnpoſsible done becauſe vvere ſeede abraham vvere circumciſed receiued lavv moyſes ſuch carnal reſpects truſted themſelues though god chriſt vvere vnſeparably bound vnto attributing alſo ſo much ovvne workes vvhich thought ſelues holpē knovvledge lavv vvould acknovvledge death chriſt neceſſarie ſaluation looked ſuch chriſt ſhould like prince vvorld make great men temporally herevpon paul vvrite epiſtles ſhevv vocation gentile reprobation ievves moreouer admoniſh chriſtian gentile receiue circumciſion ceremony moyſes lavv vviſe ievves alſo put truſt ſame rather vnderſtand novv chriſt come muſt ceaſe againe ſhevv neceſsitie chriſts comming death vvithout neither gentile could ſaued ievves vvorkes could doe ſelues although vvere alſo holpen lavv telling vvas good vvhat vvas bad ſo much al vvere ſinners therfore alſo impotent infirme lavv could take avvay ſinne infirmitie giue ſtrength fulfil vvhich gaue knovvledge of▪ vvas god onely able doe chriſts ſake onely vvould doe therfore neceſſarie al beleeue chriſt made member incorporat body vvhich catholike church ſo although neuer yet good vvorke al il ſhal haue remiſsion ſinnes nevv ſtrength vvithal make able fulfil cōmaūdemēts god lavv yea vvorkes ſhal ſo gracious god ſight vvil giue lift euerlaſting neceſsitie alſo fruite chriſtian religion therfore exhorteth al gentils ievves receiue humbly ſo alſo perſeuêre conſtantly vnto end againſt al ſeduction hereſie againſt al terror perſecution vvalke al time good vvorkes novv god hath made able doe ſame doctrine doth catholike church teach vnto day moſt exactlythe doctrine cath church concerning good vvorkes vvit vvorkes vnbeleeuing vnbaptized vvhether ievves gentile ſaue heretike schiſmatike although baptized becauſe member chriſt yea vvorke liuely member chriſt although othervviſe baptized continue vvithin church yet becauſe grace mortal ſinne vvorke doth meritorious able ſaue ſame paules doctrine paules doctrine concerning faith good vvorkes denieth vvorkes ſuch haue spirit chriſt al vertue iuſtifie ſaue neither requireth man haue knovvledge lavv haue kept afortime though othervviſe might ſaued chriſt yet vvhen chriſtened requireth neceſsitie keepe god commaundements auoiding al ſinne good vvorkes ſuch man good vvorkes attributeth much vertue catholike time neuertheleſſe vvere certaine time alſo al heretikes time vvhom peter termeth vnlearned vnſtable2 pet 3 vvho reading paules epiſtles miſconſter meaning though required good vvorkes baptiſme baptiſme held onely faith iuſtifie ſaue man therevpon apoſtles vvrote epiſtles auguſtine noteth theſe vvordes aug de fide oper ca 14 et praef pſal 31 therfore becauſe opinion ad ſalutem obtinendam ſufficere solam ſidem onely faith ſufficient obteine ſaluation riſen apoſtolical epiſtles peter iohn iames iude againſt ſpecially direct theire intention auouch vehemently fidem ſine operibus nihil prodeſſe ſaith vvithout vvorkes profiteth nothing alſo paul ſelfe define quamlibet fidem qua deum creditur whatſoeuer maner faith vvherevvith vve beleeue god holeſome expreſſe euangelical faith vvhoſe vvorkes procede louegal 5 faith quoth vvorketh loue vvherevpon faith vvhich ſome thinke ſufficient ſaluation1 cor 1 • ſo affirmeth profite nothing ſaith ſhould haue al faith ſo could remoue mountaines haue charitie nothing therfore vvill erre point reading either paules epiſtles reſt holy scripture muſt ſticke faſt doctrine catholike church 1 tim 3 vvhich church paul termeth piller ground truth aſſuring ſelf thing found contrarie herevnto faileth right ſenſe bearing alvvaies minde admonition peter 2 pet 3 ſaying alſo moſt deere brother paul according vviſedom giuen hath vvritten alſo al epiſtles ſpeaking theſe thing vvhich certaine thing hard vnderſtand vvhich vnlearned vnſtable depraue alſo reſt scripture theire ovvne perdition therfore brother foreknovving take heede leſt ye led amis error vnvviſe fall avvay ovvne ſtedfaſtnes time vvhen epistle romanes vvas vvritten argument thereof hiſtorie paul vntil came rome luke actes apoſtles vvrote exactly though vvithout mention epiſtles yet certaine ſome vvrote came vvit • vvo vnto corinthian romanes ſeemeth algal 2 epiſtle galatian vvherein yet becauſe maketh mention fouretenth yere conuerſion appeareth preached ſo long vvithout vvriting order may thus briefely gathered firſt preached galatian act 16 paſſing phrygia countrey galatia vvhereof maketh mention himſelfe alſo gal 1 vve euangelized gal 4 euangelized heretofore vvhich falſe apoſtles came perſuaded receiue circumciſion vvherevpon ſaith gal 1 maruel thus ſo ſoone trāsferred called grace chriſt vnto goſpel vviſheth therfore gal 4 ſaying vvould vvere vvith novv accordingly came vnto aftervvard vve reade act 18 vvalking order countrie galatia phrygia confirming al diſciples vvhich time alſo ſeemeth tooke order vvith thoſe contribution helpe neede chriſtians hieruſalem vvhereof ſpeaketh 1 cor 16 concerning collection made ſaincts haue ordeined church galatia ſo doe alſo vvhich vvordes alſo euident corinthian made gathering vvhen vvrote second vvhere 11 chapter maketh mention 14 yeres onely conuerſion galatian alſo rapte vvhich ſeemeth haue bene vvhen vvas hieruſalem act 9 foure yeres conuerſion traunce calleth act 22 17 vvere readie ſo ſaith 2 cor 8 haue begone yere paſt 2 cor 9 vvhich doe glorie macedonian alſo achaia ready yere paſt hovvbeit folovveth theire haue ſent brother haue ſaid may ready leſt vvhen macedonian come vvith find vnready vve aſhamed vvhen vvrote romanes vvas novv come corinth purpoſe receiued theire contribution vvas readie goe vvith vnto hieruſalem ſo ſaith rom 15 novv therfore vvil goe vnto hieruſalem miniſter ſaincts macedonia achaia haue liked vvel make ſome cōtribution vpō poore ſaincts hieruſalem argument epiſtle romanes epiſtle romanes vvas firſt vvrote yet isepih haer 42▪ marcionis aug expoſ incho ep ad rom alvvaies vvas ſet firſt becauſe primacie church vvhich cauſe alſo handleth ſuch matter perteined alone vniuerſal church ſpecially al gentile vvit frame vvere church chriſt tanquam enim2 cor 5 pro ipſo domino legatione fungens hoc eſt proepheſ 2 lapide angulari vtrumque populum tam ex iudais quàm ex gentibus connectis chriſto per vinculum gratiae ſo ſaith auguſtine giuing v briefly argument engliſh thus legate lord ſelf corner ſtone knitteth together chriſt bād grace people vvel ievves gentils shevving neither gentilitie iudaiſme vvorkes bragge chalenge ſelues iuſtificatiō ſaluation thereby rather ſinnes ſorie humble themſelues faith chriſt ſo might haue remiſsion ſtrength doe meritorius vvorkes aftervvard vvhich ſort becauſe gentils humble ſelues therefore found mercy though neuer vviſt lavv moyſes ievves becauſe ſtoode vpon ovvne vvorkes vvhich ovvne ſtrength vvith knovvledge lavv therefore alſo called vvorkes lavv vvorkes lavv ſo would humble themſelues beleeue chriſt crucified miſſed mercy became reprobate excepting reliquiae god goodnes reſerued himſelf hovvbeit end vvhen fulnes gentils come church ſhal fulnes ievves alſo open eies acknowledge errour ſubmit themſelues chriſt church like maner meane time thoſe haue found grace chriſtians exhorteth perſeuerāce vvas ſpecially needeful thoſe time perſecutions leade whole life baptiſme good workes careful vnitie circumciſion ✝ verse 29 ſecrete ievv circumciſion hart ″ ſpirit letter vvhoſe praiſe men god annotation chap ii 1 thou iudgeſt publike authoritie either ſpiritual temporal haue puniſh offender forbidden iudge condemne offenſes though ſelues ſometimes guilty conſcience ſame greater yet may matter aggrauating ſinnes godiudging men vvhen vvil repent thoſe offenſes ſelues vvhich puniſh others open offender ſelues ſame ſort vvhich iudge giue ſcandal thereby aggrauate ſinnes much proprely forbiddeth charge falſely truely vvith theſe crime vvhereof ſelf farre guilty ievves ſpecially gentils ſecond paules vvhom chriſt choſe ſpecially preach gentile ſo al either vvas limited gentils onely vvhō actes apoſtles reportneither peter ievves paul apoſtle gētiles euery place firſt haue entered god gentils ſhould firſt beleeue vvho firſt baptized firſt gaue order concerning therfore treacherie caluin intolerable vpon diſtinction apoſtles charge vvould haue ſimple ſuppoſecaluins foliſh reaſon peter vvas b rome derogaciō peter apoſtleſhip peter could biſhop rome ſo might barre • iohn epheſus▪ alſo deale among gentile thing againſt god ordinance appointment betvvene paul though thereby one bound ſelf preach meddle vvithin fellovves compaſſe vvhich moſt ſeditious exhorteth al men keepe faſt foreſaid compact rather haue reſpect paules apoſtleſhip peter though preaching authoritie apoſtleſhip vvere like true al one holy spirit vvhether preached iewes gentile preach vnto peoplesthe church founded rome peter • aul already proued length partly daily decay ievviſh ſtate hierom dialog cont lucif c 4 et ep 28 ad li • iniū hierom reckeneth vp diuers like traditiōss auguſtine vvilling men attribute apoſtles ſuch cuſtoms church hath receiued diuers chriſtian country auguſtine eſteemeth apoſtolike tradition ſo much plainely affirmeth ſundrie place onely obſeruation certaine feſtiuities faſtes ceremony whatſoeuer ſolemnities vſed catholike church holy profitable apoſtolike though notvvritten al ſcriptures often alſo vvriteth many article religion pointes higheſt importance ſo much proued ſcriptures tradition▪ namely auouching vviſe vve could beleeue child infancie ſhould baptized vvere apoſtolical tradition de gen ad lit li 10 c 23 tradition cauſed beleeue baptized heretikes ſhould rebaptized notvvithſtanding cyprian authoritie manifold ſcriptures alleaged though ſeemed neuer ſo pregnant de bap li 2 c 7 tradition onely others condemned heluidius heretike denying perpetual virginitie lady vvithout scripture neuer ſo plaines epiphanius arian macedonian eutychian pelagian zuinglian vvil yeld muſt vſe tradition ſaith epiphanius • har 61 apoſtolicorum scripture hath al thing therfore apoſtles deliuered certaine thing vvriting certaine tradition alleageth place alſo paul againe haer 55 melchiſed boundes ſet dovvne foundation building vp faith tradition apoſtles holy scripture ſucceſsion doctrine ſo truth euery vvay • inſed irenaeus li 3 c 4 irenaeus hath one notable chapter al queſtions vve muſt haue recourſe tradition apoſtles teaching v vvithal vvay trie apoſtolical tradition bring fountaine apoſtolike ſucceſſion biſhops vvomen mother yong vvomen ſiſters al chaſtitie ✝ verse 3 honour vvidovvesthe epiſtle holy vvidovves vvhich ″ vvidovves deede ✝ verse 4 vvidovv haue child nephevves let learne firſt rule ovvne houſe render mutual dutie parent acceptable god ✝ verse 5 ſhe vvidovv deede deſolate let hope god continue obſecrations becauſe continual praier vvhich ſtandeth vvith cōiugal carnal actes matrimonie care ovvne eſpecially domeſticals ″ hath denied faith vvorſe infidel ✝ verse 9 ″ let vvidovv choſen leſſe thē three ſcore yeres vvhich hath ″ vvife one huſband ✝ verse 10 hauing teſtimonie good vvorkes ſhe haue brought vp child ſhe haue receiued harbour ſhe haue vvaſhed saincts feete ſhe haue miniſtred ſuffer tribulation ſhe haue folovved euery good vvorke ⊢ ✝ verse 11 yonger vvidovves auoid vvhen ſhal ″ vvanton chriſt ″ vvil marie ✝ verse 12 ″ hauing damnation becauſe haue made void ″ firſt faith ✝ verse 13 vvithal idle alſo learne goe houſe houſe idle alſo ful vvordes curious ſpeaking thing vvhich ought ✝ verse 14 ″ vvil therfore yonger marie bring forth child houſevviues giue occaſion aduerſarie ſpeake euil ✝ verse 15 novv certaine turned backe ″ satan ✝ verse 16 faithful man haue deacon ſhould huſbands point 1 one vvife muſt needes ſignifie tvviſe maried admitted theſe like function vvere maried point 2 secondly vve proue place againſt aduerſaries ſtate vvidovvhod vvorthy honorable decent pure reſpect ſeruice church relieued reuenues thereof ſtate maried folkes▪ onely aduerſaries perhaps may anſvver greater neceſſitie leiſure freedom expedition ſerue combered vvith huſband houſhold reſpect vidual continencie chaſtitie puritie el ſuch vvere vvidovves vvith intention freedom marie aftervvard might haue admitted apoſtle vvel thoſe vvere neuer marie againe point 3 thirdly vve proue ſecond mariage onely admiſſion almes ſeruice church alſo diſagreable ſigne incontinencie luſt fleſhlines agreable comely perſon belonging church conſequently apoſtle laſt chapter treating holy function biſhops prieſts deacon church refuſing generally bigamos tvviſe maried perſons muſt needes much meane man tvviſe maried ſhould receiued holy order none vvere admitted vvidovves church euer intended marie againe ſo none ſhould euer receiued miniſter sacrament vvhich thing infinitely requireth puritie continencie office ſtate ſaid vvidovves intended marie againe receiue body commendation holy scripturesthe heretikes foliſh argumēt al scripture profitable ergo scripture neceſſarie ſufficient pretend ſimply good ſooth therfore nothing neceſſarie iuſtice ſaluation scripture though euery thing profitable neceſſarie effect excluded al helpe vvere onely ynough attaine ſame vvhich reaſon man might vvel proue old teſtament vvere ynough ſo exclude new one peece al old thereby rome dalmatia vvhen ſelf vvas ſhortly put death therefore although luke neuer name actes neither ſelf yet doubt comprehendeth commonly vvhen ſpeaketh thus firſt perſon plurall forthvvith vve ſought ſhould ſaued vvorkes moyſes lavv theſe moral vvorkes therfore paul roman diſputed ſpecially againſt prouing vvorkes done vvithout faith chriſt ſerue iuſtification ſaluation 26 faith vvithout vvorkes dead faith vvithout vvorkes true ſaith auailable body vvithout ſpirit true body though dead iames proteſtants feine ſaith faith vvithout good vvorkes faith therfore iuſtifieth becauſe faith ſaith dead vvithout vvorkes body dead vvithout ſoule therfore dead hath actiuity efficacie iuſtifie ſaue great difference ſay body dead ſay body euen ſo like difference ſay faith vvithout vvorkes dead ſay faith vvithout vvorkes faith dead body notvvithſtanding true body according iames compariſon dead faith notvvithſtanding true faith yet auailable iuſtification becauſe dead becauſe onely faith vvithout good vvorkes therfore great impudencie heretikes hard ſhift ſay faith vvhich apoſtle diſputeth al vvhilevvhat faith apoſtle ſpeaketh knevv ſpecial faith true proprely called faith ſame faith paul defined commended al 11 chapter hebrues ſame vvhich called catholike faith ſame vvhich formed made aliue charitie iuſtifieth mary true ſpecial faith vvhich heretikes feine onely iuſtifie vvit vvhen man doth
